conversationHistory.botResponse:
Hello! I can help you with storing leftover rice.

Here are some tips to minimize waste:

•   Cool rice completely, then refrigerate in an airtight container. (Shelf life: 2-4 days)

•   Freeze rice in a freezer-safe bag or container. (Shelf life: 1-2 months)

•   Make fried rice (30 BDT) with leftover rice and vegetables.

Reducing food waste helps lower greenhouse gas emissions in Bangladesh.

Next step: Refrigerate or freeze your rice immediately to keep it fresh.

conversationHistory.userMessage: What vegetables are rich in vitamins?
conversationHistory.botResponse:
Hello! Here's how to get more vitamins from vegetables.

• Focus on dark leafy greens like spinach (20 BDT/kg) and broccoli (80 BDT/kg).

• Also consider carrots (30 BDT/kg) and sweet potatoes (40 BDT/kg).

• These are easily available in local markets.

• These vegetables help boost your immune system.

Next step: Include one of these vitamin-rich vegetables in your next meal.

conversationHistory.userMessage: Suggest a meal plan for 300 BDT
conversationHistory.botResponse:
Hello! Here is a meal plan idea.

• Main: Chicken and vegetable curry with rice (250 BDT). This provides protein and essential vitamins.

• Cheaper alternative: Egg and lentil curry with rice (150 BDT). This is a balanced and budget-friendly option.

Shopping tip: Visit local markets for fresh produce to save money.

Next step: Choose one of these options for your next meal.
